learning_outcomes.description: Describe and discuss key concepts in Natural Language Processing.
Create computational models of natural language based on the concepts learned in the course.
Evaluate the mathematical and/or algorithmic basis of common NLP techniques.
Apply relevant techniques and/or interface with existing python APIs.
Create end-to-end research experiments, including evaluation of text corpora as well as presentation and interpretation of results.
Critically analyze and evaluate state-of-the-art text processing systems and communicate criticisms clearly.

assessments.task_description: The first assignment will be a task to familiarise yourself with basic text parsing, extraction, and manipulation. The assignment will use Python and will be a well-defined programming task.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: 100% Late Penalty after 1 hour grace period The one-hour grace period is recorded from the time the submission is due.Â
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description: The first assignment will be a task to familiarise yourself with basic text parsing, extraction, and manipulation. The assignment will use Python and will be a well-defined programming task.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: This will be a more open ended and challenging task that will draw on what you have learned this semester. The student will be expected to conduct a comparative analysis of several state-of-the-art solutions to a "hot topic" in NLP using at least two datasets. The analysis will be written up in a 5-page report using a template that will be provided when the assignment is released. The report should include a detailed comparative analysis of the algorithms used, a clear and concise description of each algorithm, and include tables and graphs summarising the experiments ran. The datasets and necessary GPU hardware will be provided by the course coordinator, along with a description of the task, including at least one example baseline algorithm.
assessments.submission_guidelines: The report as well as the code to reproduce all of the results will be submitted as a zip file in Blackboard.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: The final exam will be a 2-hour, invigilated exam covering the concepts learned in the course.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.
